p: Several other countries in Eastern Europe had much fewer deaths after the first eight weeks of fighting the virus, as a result of early lockdowns. This is certainly encouraging is a praiseworthy success for those nations’ epidemiologists and Civil Protection Headquarters. However, if one wants to understand the true state of affairs with this pandemic when countries are performing well, it is a good idea to look first at Singapore, the United Arab Emirates, Qatar, and Japan. These ambitious nations strive to be the best in the world in solving pretty much every task. That is why the state in those countries is a reliable reflection of what can be expected in the best-case scenario. All four of them are currently fighting outbreaks with a free spread of COVID-19 and they have introduced stricter measures of social distancing − something that only a few would have expected two weeks ago [ 9].
